grapes_details.description: Grapes are small, round berries that grow in clusters on deciduous woody vines. They are cultivated for consumption as fresh fruit, for making wine, juice, jelly, and raisins.
grapes_details.nutritional value: Grapes are rich in vitamins, especially vitamin C and vitamin K, as well as antioxidants and dietary fiber. They promote heart health, aid digestion, and support immune function.
grapes_details.cultivation: Grapes are grown in temperate regions around the world. They require well-drained soil, ample sunlight, and a long, warm growing season.
grapes_details.varieties: Table grapes, Wine grapes, Seedless grapes, Concord grapes, Thompson Seedless
grapes_details.uses: Fresh consumption, Winemaking, Juicing, Drying (raisins), Cooking

prerequisites.soil: Well-drained soil with good fertility and pH between 5.5 and 7.0
prerequisites.climate: Temperate climate with warm summers and mild winters, with temperatures ranging between 60°F to 95°F (15°C to 35°C) during the growing season.
prerequisites.sunlight: Grapes require full sunlight for optimal growth and fruit ripening.
prerequisites.water: Regular watering, especially during the growing season and fruit development, while avoiding excessive moisture that can lead to fungal diseases.
prerequisites.pruning: Regular pruning is essential to control vine growth, improve air circulation, and promote fruit production.
prerequisites.space: Sufficient spacing between vines for airflow and sunlight penetration, typically 6 to 10 feet apart in rows spaced 8 to 12 feet apart.
